briefing.opening: Good morning, everyone. We will now begin the climate briefing for January 17, 2026.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Global Climate Crisis Phenomena and Unexpected Threats
sections.content: Globally, severe signs of climate change are emerging simultaneously. In Australia, large-scale wildfires are spreading amidst heatwaves exceeding 40 degrees Celsius, while Northern Europe is experiencing record-breaking cold snaps, indicating a continuation of extreme weather phenomena [3]. Furthermore, changes in ecosystems are being observed, such as early spring wildflowers blooming earlier than usual and flowers blossoming in January in the Victoria region. Concerns have also been raised about whether Costa Rica's cloud forests can cope with climate change [15, 22, 21]. Among unexpected threats, deaths due to mushroom poisoning are occurring in connection with climate change [19], and in Iran, drought has been identified as one of the hidden keywords behind anti-government protests, thus impacting social instability [13]. These climate crisis situations are fueling a desalination boom, prompting the search for new response measures [25].

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Domestic Carbon Neutrality Implementation and Efforts to Expand Renewable Energy
sections.content: Domestically, various efforts to achieve carbon neutrality goals are materializing. Gwangmyeong G-Smart Hub has opened as a 'Carbon-Neutral Smart City,' and KEPCO KPS announced its plan to focus this year's budget execution on AI, safety, regional cooperation, and carbon neutrality [4, 6, 5]. Chungcheongbuk-do Province has signed a business agreement to accelerate the dissemination of renewable energy, and expectations are growing for the revitalization of the renewable energy PPA (Power Purchase Agreement) trading market [7, 9]. Indeed, a case where a city selling renewable energy solved the challenges of a small and medium-sized enterprise with 120 billion won in sales was introduced as a 'Net-Zero Case Study,' demonstrating the economic value of renewable energy [8, 11]. The CEO of GridWiz emphasized that 'power flexibility' will hold economic value in the era of AI and renewable energy, and KOSPO (Korea Southern Power) is showing technical and business progress, including completing the financial closure of overseas renewable energy projects [10, 12]. Furthermore, Gijang-gun, Busan, is proactively managing crop pests and diseases in preparation for climate change, thus undertaking adaptation efforts concurrently [2].

sections.title: ğŸŒ International Climate Change Discourse and the Complexity of Response
sections.content: The international community continues to engage in diverse discussions regarding the direction of climate change response. Fundamental questions are being raised, such as the assertion that 'Net Zero is a catastrophic ideology,' leading to discussions on how the Earth can achieve a 'soft landing' [1]. While the latest data from the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) provides information on climate change, emphasizing the importance of scientific analysis [18], efforts to raise awareness continue across various sectors of society. These include films reflecting on paths we could have taken regarding climate change being re-examined [17], and an author exploring the impacts of climate change on their own street [16]. Additionally, the director of 'Spotlight' is set to adapt the climate change book 'Losing Earth' [20], and institutions in various countries, such as India's Space Research Organisation (ISRO), are actively assisting with climate change adaptation and response [23]. However, UN Secretary-General Guterres warned of 'powerful forces hindering international cooperation,' highlighting the importance and challenges of global solidarity in responding to climate change [27].

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Economic Restructuring and Adaptation Strategies in the Era of Climate Change
sections.content: Climate change is demanding a restructuring of the global economic system, presenting both new opportunities and challenges simultaneously. An analysis suggests that while the value of agriculture is being re-evaluated due to climate change, investors have not yet caught up [24]. Meanwhile, news that climate change is fueling a desalination boom indicates an acceleration in the search for technological solutions to water scarcity [25]. Domestically, Gijang-gun, Busan, is making concrete efforts for climate change adaptation, such as proactively managing crop pests and diseases [2]. Coupled with expectations for the revitalization of the renewable energy PPA trading market, the forecast that an era where 'power flexibility' holds economic value will arrive signals new trends in the energy market [9, 10]. The case of solving a small and medium-sized enterprise's challenges through renewable energy sales suggests that responding to climate change can be an opportunity for creating new economic value, not just a cost [8, 11].

briefing.closing: Today's briefing highlights the severity of the climate crisis while also demonstrating the multifaceted global efforts underway to overcome it. Through sustained attention and cooperation, we must effectively respond to climate change. This concludes today's climate briefing.

articles.description: Anti-government protesters gathered on the streets of Tehran, Iran, on the 8th. Getty Images. When merchants of Tehran's Grand Bazaar (traditional market) closed their shops and took to the streets on the 28th of last month (local time), it was not expected that these protests would escalate into the worst bloodshed since the establishment of the Islamic Republic of Iran in 1979. The protests, triggered by the plummeting Iranian rial and soaring prices, spread across Iran and...

summary.phenomenon: On the 28th of last month (local time), anti-government protests were triggered as merchants of Tehran's Grand Bazaar in Iran closed their shops and took to the streets. This escalated into the worst bloodshed since the establishment of the Islamic Republic of Iran in 1979. Anti-government protesters also gathered on the streets of Tehran on the 8th.
summary.cause: The protests were triggered by the plummeting Iranian rial and soaring prices.
